alert.note: Alert for Okeechobee; Osceola (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 01 at 2:42PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Okeechobee and central Osceola Counties through 315 PM EDT... At 241 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles northeast of Lake Wales to 8 miles southwest of Lake Kissimmee to near Lake Istokpoga. Movement was northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Lake Kissimmee, Basinger, Lake Marian, and Kissimmee Prairie Preserve. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. If on or near Lake Kissimmee, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until these storms pass.
